questions.text: Match the following classical presentations with its diagnosis:
questions.explanation:
References:

  • ↳ Production of symptoms after an stress factor results in reduction in anxiety. This is known as Primary Gain . It occurs unconsciously. Production of symptoms also results in giving more attention to the patient which further results in propagation of symptoms. This is known as Secondary Gain . This is conscious phenomenon. Forms of conversion: Sensory Symptoms: Anesthesia [Test- Mapping dermatomes] Hemianesthesia [Test- Check midline] Pseudoblindness [Test: Visual Evoked Provocation > Optokinetic nystagmus] Motor Symptoms: Paralysis (most common symptom) [Test- Dropping paralysed hand onto face, Hoover test, Astasia-abusia (Gait)] Aphonia [Cough test] Pseudo-seizures La Belle Indiff é rence: Lack of emotional reactivity to suffering Not pathognomic of conversion disorder Epidemiology: Females > Males Symptoms are more common on left side than on right side of body This is also known as Function Neurological Symptom Disorder .
  • ↳ Production of symptoms after an stress factor results in reduction in anxiety. This is known as Primary Gain . It occurs unconsciously.
  • ↳ Production of symptoms also results in giving more attention to the patient which further results in propagation of symptoms. This is known as Secondary Gain . This is conscious phenomenon.
  • ↳ Forms of conversion: Sensory Symptoms: Anesthesia [Test- Mapping dermatomes] Hemianesthesia [Test- Check midline] Pseudoblindness [Test: Visual Evoked Provocation > Optokinetic nystagmus] Motor Symptoms: Paralysis (most common symptom) [Test- Dropping paralysed hand onto face, Hoover test, Astasia-abusia (Gait)] Aphonia [Cough test] Pseudo-seizures
  • ↳ Forms of conversion:
  • ↳ Sensory Symptoms: Anesthesia [Test- Mapping dermatomes] Hemianesthesia [Test- Check midline] Pseudoblindness [Test: Visual Evoked Provocation > Optokinetic nystagmus] Motor Symptoms: Paralysis (most common symptom) [Test- Dropping paralysed hand onto face, Hoover test, Astasia-abusia (Gait)] Aphonia [Cough test] Pseudo-seizures

  • ↳ It is also known as Illness Anxiety Disorder . It is characterized by PERCEPTION OF HAVING A SERIOUS LIFE THREATENING ILLNESS. E.g., Cough à Lung cancer Headache à Brain tumour In this, the patient will be preoccupied with the diagnosis/illness. Patient asks for diagnosis confirmation.

  • ↳ Body Dysmorphic Disorder:
  • ↳ In DSM- IV, it was classified under Somatoform disorders. In DSM-5, it is classified under OCD and related disorder. It is characterized by preoccupation with an imagined defect in body appearance, so that the person feels that a part of his/her body (most common- hair> nose=skin) is disfigured.
  • ↳ In DSM- IV, it was classified under Somatoform disorders.
  • ↳ In DSM-5, it is classified under OCD and related disorder.

questions.text: A 37-year-old woman was brought to ER with physically aggressive behaviour towards her neighbour. On asking the patient, she reported that herself and her neighbour had a fight with each other a few days back following which she noticed that her neighbours are causing her to have electric shock like sensations. She reports that they can do this as they have planted a chip in her brain. The psychopathology described above is
questions.explanation:
References:

  • ↳ Reference:

  • ↳ Somatic Passivity:
  • ↳ It is the belief that outside influences are playing on the body. Patient believes that the somatic sensations are caused by foreign agency.

questions.text: A 23-year-old was a patient of Bipolar Affective Disorder and was maintaining well on Tab. Lithium 300 mg 1-0-3. He was brought to ER with 6-7 episodes of diarrhea. On examination, the patient had coarse tremors and was not orientated to time and place. Next step of management is

A 30-year-old man presented ER with dusky macules and blisters on skin. On examination, there was skin detachment seen. On asking the relatives, they said that the patient was started on a mood stabilizer 1 week back. Drug, most likely responsible is
A 17-year-old girl wakes in the middle of the night with a scream. On getting up, she was not aware of what happened and looked confused to her mother. The most likely diagnosis is:

A 14-year-old boy is brought to the emergency department with a 4-h history of acute, severe left scrotal pain. Examination reveals a high-riding left testicle and scrotal exploration was done. Which of the following is true?

options.label: C
options.text: Detorsion and orchidopexy of the same side

options.label: D
options.text: Detorsion and orchidopexy of both sides

questions.correct_answer: D. Detorsion and orchidopexy of both sides

questions.text: A neonate presented with a cystic swelling in the neck which was brilliantly transilluminant. Which of the following is true about the swelling?

options.label: B
options.text: Most common location is the posterior triangle of neck

options.label: C
options.text: Diagnostic imaging modality is CT scan

questions.correct_answer: B. Most common location is the posterior triangle of neck

questions.text: Gall bladder carcinoma is M1 stage when which of the following lymph nodes are involved?

options.label: D

questions.correct_answer: C. General anaesthesia is not required

questions.text: A patient presents with obstructive jaundice. A periampullary mass was seen on CT scan. Which of the following is the most common periampullary malignancy?

A patient presents with recurrent pain abdomen. A diagnosis of chronic pancreatitis due to pancreas divisum is made. Which of the following procedures is used in patients with pancreas divisum with chronic pancreatitis?
A patient present with pain and tenderness in the left iliac fossa. USG shows a 3 cm stone in the renal pelvis without any hydro-nephrosis. Most appropriate management:
Which of the following is not true regarding pancreatic trauma?

options.label: A
options.text: Most commonly due to blunt trauma

options.label: B
options.text: Penetrating trauma commonly involves neck and body of pancreas

options.label: C
options.text: Active bleeding and pancreatic hematoma are signs of pancreatic trauma in CECT

options.label: D
options.text: low pancreatic attenuation and diffuse enlargement are hard signs of pancreatic trauma in CECT

questions.correct_answer: A. Most commonly due to blunt trauma

questions.text: Assertion: Ileal resection predisposes to gallstone formation Reason: Increased bilirubin levels following ileal resection results in pigment type gallstones

options.label: A
options.text: Both assertion and reason are true and reason is the correct explanation of the assertion

options.label: B
options.text: Both assertion and reason are true but reason is not the correct explanation of the assertion

options.label: C
options.text: Assertion is true but reason is false

options.label: D
options.text: Assertion is false but reason is true

questions.correct_answer: C. Assertion is true but reason is false

questions.text: Prophylactic cholecystectomy should be considered in all except?

options.label: D
options.text: Short common channel of pancreatic and CBD

questions.correct_answer: D. Short common channel of pancreatic and CBD

questions.text: Most common cause of chylous ascites in adults?
A patient underwent amputation for a trophic ulcer present at the base of the 1st toe. X ray was performed on day 15 post amputation. Identify the amputation performed in the picture shown below
Congenital cause of hypercoagulable states are all except

A 25-year-old woman presents to the emergency room complaining of redness and pain in her right foot up to the level of the midcalf. She reports that her right lower extremity has been swollen for at least 15 years, but her left leg has been normal. On physical examination, she has a temperature of 39°C (102.2°F) and the right lower extremity is nontender with nonpitting edema from the groin down to the foot. There is cellulitis of the right foot without ulcers or skin discoloration. The left leg is normal. Which of the following is the most likely underlying problem?
Which of the following is the most appropriate indication for placement of IVC filter?

options.label: A
options.text: Recurrent pulmonary embolus despite adequate anticoagulation therapy

options.label: C
options.text: Pulmonary embolus due to DVT of the lower extremity that occurs 2 weeks postoperatively

options.label: D
options.text: DVT in a patient with patient with metastatic carcinoma

questions.correct_answer: A. Recurrent pulmonary embolus despite adequate anticoagulation therapy

questions.text: Gross Specimen of Femur with tumour in 10 year old kid at the lower end of femur :
Which drug promotes bone formation :
During Re Implantation of an amputated digit , which of the following is done first ?
Wilson’s fracture is :
Fracture of both bone forearm, after manipulation we apply POP Cast. What should be the position of the forearm while cast application?

An eight year old child sustained a fracture in proximal one third of humerus following a trivial fall at home. X ray was done which shows a lytic lesion at the fracture site which was never noticed till now. What is the likely diagnosis ?
A previously healthy 45 years old labourer suddenly develops acute lower back pain with right-leg pain and weakness of dorsiflexion of the right great toe. Which of the following is true:

options.label: A
options.text: Immediate treatment should include analgesics muscle relaxants and back strengthening exercises.

options.label: B
options.text: The appearance of the foot drop indicates early surgical intervention.

options.label: C
options.text: If the neurological sign resolves within 2–3 weeks but low back pain persists, the proper treatment would include fusion of affected lumbar vertebra.

options.label: D
options.text: If the neurological signs fail to resolve within 1 week , lumbar laminectomy and excision of any herniated nucleus pulposus should be done.

questions.correct_answer: B. The appearance of the foot drop indicates early surgical intervention.

questions.text: Muscle most commonly affected by congenital absence is:
A 60 year old female patient is undergoing resection of spinal tumour at D7-8 level . Evoked potential monitoring is being done. Which evoked potential will be most suitable for the surgery
Regarding cesarean section which is not a correct statement

options.label: A
options.text: Level of spinal anaesthesia should be T4-L5

options.label: B
options.text: Pt placed supine with wedge under left hip

options.label: C
options.text: 100 % Oxygen should be given for atleast 3-5 min

options.label: D
options.text: Rapid sequence induction with cricoids pressure is performed using scoline.

questions.correct_answer: A. Level of spinal anaesthesia should be T4-L5

questions.text: Which is not a clinical manifestation of using polymethylmethacylate in orthopedic surgery
A 40 year old undergoing arthroscopy of shoulder can be done with which block

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: External diameter of tube should be 5 mm

options.label: C
options.text: Using 4 mm tube will be most easy

options.label: D
options.text: Both a and b are correct options

Which type of cerebral herniation can result in occlusion of the ipsilateral posterior cerebral artery?
Which of the following is NOT a cause of prominent basal ganglia calcification?

Which label identifies the insertion of the biceps brachii tendon?
Which numbered arrow indicates the lentiform nucleus?
Which patient has Langerhans cell histiocytosis?
Open-ring enhancement is typical of which of the following conditions?

A 65-year-old patient presents with a vulvar lesion as shown in the given image. On histopathology examination there is hyperplasia of keratinocytes in the prickle cell layer (stratum spinosum) thickening the epidermis. This is descriptive of which of the following?
Approximately what percentage of spontaneous first-trimester abortions shows chromosomal abnormalities?
A 29-year-old G5P0 SAB4 woman is taking Coumadin for a DVT she suffered 3 months ago. She is now 8 weeks’ pregnant. What is the most appropriate course of action?

options.label: B
options.text: Stay on Coumadin until 12 weeks and then switch to heparin

options.label: C
options.text: Switch to heparin at this time

questions.correct_answer: C. Switch to heparin at this time

questions.text: A patient with polycystic ovarian syndrome will often have an increase in insulin resistance (commonly known as metabolic X syndrome). The subsequent menstrual irregularities are a result of an increase in which of the following?

Given that prostaglandins (PGs) appear to be involved in preterm labor, which of the following medications might provide some help through interference with PG synthesis or release in stopping preterm labor?
Treatment modality shown in image below is related with management of?
A woman complains of postvoid dribbling of urine when she stands, painful intercourse, and dysuria. She has no other symptoms. Which of the following is she most likely to have?

A 23-year-old G1P1 patient is using barrier contraception and is 1 week past onset of her last mense. She is found to have bilaterally equal adnexal pain; cervical motion tenderness; direct abdominal tenderness; temperature, 101.3°F; and WBC, 12,000/mL. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

options.label: D
options.text: Ruptured corpus luteum cyst of the ovary

questions.text: Compared to users of combination OCs, users of progestin-only OCs (minipills) are less likely to experience which of the following?

A 31-year-old patient is preparing to start in vitro fertilization (IVF) because of obstructed fallopian tubes. On hysterosalpin-gogram (HSG), it is noted that she has large dilated hydrosalpinges present bilaterally. What should be your next step?

options.label: A
options.text: The patient should begin her IVF treatment cycle.

options.label: B
options.text: The patient should repeat the HSG to confirm the result.

options.label: C
options.text: The patient should not be offered the opportunity to have IVF

options.label: D
options.text: Bilateral salpingectomies should be done prior to starting IVF

questions.correct_answer: D. Bilateral salpingectomies should be done prior to starting IVF

questions.text: A 16-year-old G0P0 patient reports delayed onset of menses, the sudden onset of severe pain, and syncope. A serum pregnancy test is negative. Her CBC reveals an Hct of 42% and a WBC of 8,000. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

options.label: D
options.text: Ruptured corpus luteum cyst of the ovary

questions.correct_answer: D. Ruptured corpus luteum cyst of the ovary

questions.text: BIRADS stands for:

options.label: A
options.text: Breast Imaging Reporting and Data System

options.label: C
options.text: Brain Imaging Reporting and Data System

options.label: D
options.text: Bone Imaging Reporting and Data System

questions.correct_answer: A. Breast Imaging Reporting and Data System

questions.text: Puerperal infection may be spread by several routes. Which of the following is the most common route that results in serious complication of a septic thrombophlebitis?
Chemotherapy is recommended in post evacuation phase of molar pregnancy in all, except:

A 23-year-old woman (gravida 1, para 0), approximately 6 weeks pregnant, comes to your clinic for treatment. A home pregnancy test was positive 1 ½ weeks ago. She has developed bleeding over the past 2 days. What is the most likely cause of the bleeding?
An 84-year-old lady, with history of MI and on therapy for severe hypertension and cardiac failure, is also having procidentia. The ideal surgery for her is:

A 30-year-old woman (gravida 4, para 2, abortus 1) has been seen in the emergency department at 29 weeks’ gestation because of the sudden onset of painless vaginal bleeding that soaked four perineal pads and has now ceased. The mother’s vital signs and Hct are normal, and the FHTs are regular at 140 bpm. At this time, what should you do?

options.label: D
options.text: Send the patient home on bed rest

questions.text: At an annual examination of a 33-year-old woman, a 3 x 4 mm mass is noted on the lateral aspect of her vagina approximately 3 cm internally from the introitus and at the 3 o’clock position. Which of the following biopsy findings would be most abnormal?

options.label: A
options.text: A small (3-mm) cyst lined by simple cuboidal epithelium

options.label: D
options.text: A thin fibromuscular coat beneath the epithelium

questions.correct_answer: A. A small (3-mm) cyst lined by simple cuboidal epithelium

questions.text: What is the maximum normal time for the second stage of labor in a primigravida without anesthesia?
Which of the following factors contribute to the increase in cardiac output in pregnancy?

options.label: D
options.text: Increase in left ventricular stroke work index

questions.text: A 31-year-old healthy woman (gravida 3, para 2) is in labor at 40 weeks’ gestation. Her first delivery was a low transverse cesarean for breech; the second was an uncomplicated VBAC. Her vital signs have been stable. Her epidural is functioning and she is lying on her side. When the cervix was approximately 7-cm dilated and the fetus was at –1 station, she developed tachycardia to 120 and a drop in blood pressure from 115/60 to 70/30. She has become dizzy upon sitting up. FHTs are 130. No bleeding is evident. The hematocrit is reported at 35%. What is your primary diagnosis?

A patient is being evaluated for excessive postpartum vaginal bleeding after a successful VBAC (vaginal birth after C-section) of a 3,500-g infant. One concern is retained placental tissue. Placental separation is facilitated by which of the following?

options.label: A
options.text: Deep placental growth into the myometrium

options.label: B
options.text: Presence of a layer of decidua

options.label: D
options.text: The changing configuration of the uterus after fetal delivery

questions.correct_answer: D. The changing configuration of the uterus after fetal delivery

questions.text: A patient is found to be blood type A negative during her first pregnancy. She receives antenatal RhoGAM at 28 weeks. At 32 weeks she develops severe preeclampsia and is induced, resulting in an uncomplicated vaginal delivery. The infant does well and is found to be A positive. The mother is found to have anti-D immunoglobulin at a titer of 1:1. Which of the following best describes how much RhoGAM the patient should receive?

options.label: A
options.text: No RhoGAM since she is sensitized

questions.text: During late pregnancy, which of the following implies urinary tract disease?

options.label: B
options.text: Failure to excrete concentrated urine after 18 hours without fluids

questions.text: What is the most common association with heart disease in pregnancy?
Given finding on transabdominal pelvic ultrasound image is seen in:

A 24-year-old married white woman was exposed to rubella at 7 to 8 weeks’ gestation. Several days later she developed a red macular rash and had a rubella antibody titer of 1:160 when seen by you at 11 weeks’ gestation.What is the approximate risk of the fetus having serious congenital abnormalities?
When performing a vaginal hysterectomy for any indication, prevention of future enterocele or vaginal vault prolapse is aided by which of the following?

options.label: A
options.text: Reattachment of the round ligaments to the vaginal cuff

options.label: C
options.text: Reattachment of the cardinal and uterosacral ligaments to the vaginal cuff

options.label: D
options.text: Complete a purse string suture closure of the cul-de-sac peritoneum

questions.correct_answer: C. Reattachment of the cardinal and uterosacral ligaments to the vaginal cuff

questions.text: In anticipation of a possible postpartum hemorrhage due to the prolonged induction and macrosomia, which of the following options is best for the prevention of excess blood loss?

options.label: A
options.text: Oxytocin 10 units IM if bleeding exceeds 500 cc

options.label: B
options.text: Type and cross 2 units of packed red blood cells

options.label: C
options.text: Epidural anesthesia to facilitate manual removal of the placenta if needed

options.label: D
options.text: 600 ?g of prostaglandin E1 (misoprostol) given per rectum after delivery of the placenta

questions.correct_answer: D. 600 ?g of prostaglandin E1 (misoprostol) given per rectum after delivery of the placenta

questions.text: A complete blood cell count is typically obtained at the initiation of prenatal care. This test is important as an indicator of general nutritional status. In the pregnant population, anemia can best be defined as which of the following?

options.label: B
options.text: A genetic defect in ferritin synthesis

questions.text: An 8-month-old infant is seen in the ED for diarrhea. The family reports that the child has had a 2-day history of nonbloody diarrhea and poor fluid intake. Triage vital signs show heart rate of 180 beats per minute, respiratory rate of 30 breaths per minute, and blood pressure of 60/40 mm Hg. On physical examination be has poor skin turgor, 5-second capillary refill, and cool extremities. Which of the following fluids is most appropriate first step in the management of this condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Dextrose 5% in 1/4 normal saline (DS ¼ NS)

questions.text: A 14-year-old boy is seen in the physicians’ office for a laceration on this hand. The mother reports that he was at school when he became agitated and punched a wall. His past medical history reveals a diagnosis of mild autism and obsessive compulsive disorder for which he takes fluoxetine. He does poorly in special education classes at the local school. On physical examination the temperature is 37OC (98.5OF), heart rate is 74 beats per minute, respiratory rate 16 breaths per minute, and blood pressure of 110/64 mm Hg. Height and weight are 35th percentile, and the head circumference is 95th percentile. He has a long and thin face. The ears are large and protruding. The mucous membranes are moist and without lesions; the palate is arched and high. The chest is clear and with mild pectus excavatum. Heart has a normal S1 and S2 with a click over the mitral valve area. His phallus is normal in size and shape, and testes are enlarged. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 2-week-old neonate is seen in the pediatrician’s office with the maternal concern of poor feeding. The mother reports that since birth her bottle-fed newborn sleeps most of the day; she has to awaken her every 4 hours to feed and she will take only 50ml of formula at a time. She voids about twice a day and passes hard, pellet-like stools every other day. On physical examination growth parameters are at the 50th percentile for weight, length, and 95th percentile for head circumference. Temperature is 35OC (95OF), heart rate 75 beats per minute, and respiratory rate is 35 breaths per minute. The newborn is jaundiced and somewhat difficult to awaken. The head is normocephalic with enlarged, flat anterior and posterior fontanels. Pupils are equally round and reactive to light; red reflex is normal. The chest has equal and unlabored breath sounds. Abdomen is soft, nontender, distended and with a large umbilical hernia. Which of the following is the most likely etiology for these findings?

A 48-hour-old neonate in the normal newborn nursery develops deep cyanosis with crying. He was born vaginally at term to a 19-year-old mother with scant prenatal care. She reports no problems during the pregnancy. On physical examination vital signs and growth parameters are normal. Chest has good air movement without distress. Heart has increased apical impulse that is displaced to the left. Left ventricular impulse is prominent. The first heart sound is increased in intensity; the second heart sound is single. A 4 out of 6 holosystolic murmur along the left sternal border is found. Distal pulses are normal. Capillary refill time is less than 3 seconds. Abdomen is soft, nontender, and the liver is felt 3 cm below the costal margin. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 2-year-old child is seen in the emergency for cough and respiratory distress, the father reports that he was awakened in the middle of the night by his son who had developed noisy breathing on inspiration, respiratory distress, and a new barking cough. He has had an upper respiratory infection for the previous 2 days with nasal discharge, sneezing, and a mild, dry cough. Past medical history is negative. His vaccines are current. On physical examination temperature is 38.4OC (101.1OF), heart rate is 90 beats per minute, and respiratory rate is 24 breaths per minute. Nose has clear nasal discharge. Ears canals are patents with translucent tympanic membranes. Chest has good, equal air movement, marked retractions of the chest wall and flaring of the nostrils. A prominent barking cough is heard. Which of the following is the most appropriate next step?

options.label: A
options.text: Short-acting bronchodilators and a 5-day course of steroids

options.label: C
options.text: Observation for hypoxia and dehydration alone

options.label: D
options.text: Inhaled epinephrine and a dose of steroids

questions.correct_answer: D. Inhaled epinephrine and a dose of steroids

questions.text: A 4-month-old infant is seen by emergency room physician for a 3-day history of poor feeding, emesis, and diarrhea. She is given a fluid bolus via interosseous line, has subsequent urine output, and an intravenous line is obtained. Her care is transferred to the inpatient pediatric hospitalist team. Results from laboratories drawn in the ED are now available and show: Sodium: 157 mEq/L Potassium: 3.9 mEq/L Chloride: 120 mEq/L Bicarbonate: 14 mEq/L Glucose: 195 mg/dL Creatinine: 1.8 mEq/L Blood urea nitrogen (BUN): 68 mEq/L Which of the following is the most appropriate next step in her management?

options.label: B
options.text: Continued rapid volume expansion with one-fourth normal saline

questions.text: A 7-year old presents to your office for puffy eyes. Her past history is significant for attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) for which she takes a stimulant medicine, and an upper respiratory tract infection that resolved the previous week. Her blood pressure is 97/57 mm Hg, heart rate is 90 beats per minute, and respiratory rate is 18 breaths per minute. A careful physical examination reveals bilateral orbital, labial, and ankle edema. Her examination is otherwise normal. You obtain a urinalysis that reveals 4+ protein, without leukocytes or blood, and her serum creatinine is 0.2 mg/dL. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

options.label: D
options.text: Nephrotic syndrome due to minimal change disease

questions.correct_answer: D. Nephrotic syndrome due to minimal change disease

questions.text: A 21-year-old woman has just delivered a term infant. She has had only one visit to her obstetrician, and that was at about 6 weeks of pregnancy. She provides her laboratory results from that visit. The delivered infant is microcephalic, and has cataracts, a heart murmur, and hepatosplenomegaly. Your further evaluation of the neonate demonstrates thrombocytopenia, mild hemolytic anemia, and on the echocardiogram, patent ductus arteriosus and peripheral pulmonary artery, stenosis. Which of the following is the most likely etiology of this neonate’s condition?

A 14-year-old boy is seen in the weight management clinic as a referral from a pediatric pulmonologist who has diagnosed him with sleep apnea. His foster family knows little of his history other than he has relatively poor school performance. On physical examination his weight is well over the 99th percentile and his height is at the 10yh percentile. He has almond-shaped eyes and strabismus. His abdomen is obsess with a well-healed scar on the left side. He has small hands and feet, and is tanner stage 1 with overall hypogenitalism. His condition is most likely related to which of the following?

options.label: D
options.text: Loss of the paternally inherited allele of chromosome 15q11

options.label: E
options.text: Loss of the maternally inherited allele of chromosome 15q11

questions.correct_answer: D. Loss of the paternally inherited allele of chromosome 15q11

questions.text: The baseline incidence of congenital heart disease is about 1%. For a family with a child with isolated congenital heart disease, the incidence of heart disease in future children is which of the following?
Select the most appropriate statement regarding “Inner ear

options.label: A
options.text: The scala tympani, containing endolymph, communicates with the subarachnoid space via the cochlear aqueduct

options.label: B
options.text: There are 3-4 rows of outer hair cells which are arranged in rows in a pattern of a W

options.label: C
options.text: Inner hair cells are less resistant.

options.label: D
options.text: The stria vascularis is located on the outer aspect of the cochlear duct

questions.correct_answer: B. There are 3-4 rows of outer hair cells which are arranged in rows in a pattern of a W

questions.text: Given image is a typical finding seen in:

questions.correct_answer: B. Bilateral conductive deafness in an adult patient is a common presentation

questions.text: Type of Incision shown in th image is known as
Choose the incorrect statement regarding “Sound transmission in the middle ear”

options.label: A
options.text: The intact tympanic membrane protects the round window and directs sound energy to the ossicular chain and oval window

options.label: B
options.text: The ossicular leverage action ratio of the malleus and incus is about 1.3:1

options.label: C
options.text: The physiological ratio of tympanic membrane to oval window surface area is about 21 : 1

options.label: D
options.text: The transformer ratio of the ossicular chain plus the tympanic membrane is about 18: 1

questions.correct_answer: C. The physiological ratio of tympanic membrane to oval window surface area is about 21 : 1

questions.text: Which of the following statements does not apply to onchocerciasis?

options.label: A
options.text: The adult form is the main ocular parasite

options.label: B
options.text: Because it is transmitted by the Simulium black fly,which breeds in the fast flowing rivers, it is also called river blindness

options.label: C
options.text: The parasite Onchocerca volvulus is a filarial nematode

options.label: D
options.text: Sclerosing keratitis is the main cause of blindness.

options.label: E
options.text: It is the major cause of blindness worldwide.

questions.correct_answer: A. The adult form is the main ocular parasite
